item.title: Pokemon Trading Card Game Pocket ‘Eevee Grove’ expansion launches June 26
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/pokemon-trading-card-game-pocket-eevee-grove-expansion-launches-june-26

  • Smartphone

New cards featuring Eevee and its eight Evolutions.

Pokemon Trading Card Game Pocket expansion “Eevee Grove” will launch on June 26, The Pokemon Company announced.

The description reads: “In Eevee Grove, players can collect new Pokemon Trading Card Game Pocket cards featuring Eevee and its eight Evolutions in vibrant illustrations that capture their lively expressions and dynamic personalities. To celebrate the release, a new binder cover and display board featuring these fan-favorite Pokemon will be available soon.”

Pokemon Trading Card Game Pocket is available now for iOS via App Store and Android via Google Play.

item.title: Beat Saber ends support for PS VR2, PS VR
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/beat-saber-ends-support-for-ps-vr2-ps-vr

  • PS VR
  • PS VR2
  • PS4
  • PS5

No new updates or downloadable content starting today.

Beat Games will end support for the PlayStation VR2 and PlayStation VR versions of Beat Saber, the developer announced. End of support for updates and downloadable content starts today, and multiplayer will no longer be available starting January 21, 2026.

The PlayStation VR2 and PlayStation VR versions will remain playable and purchasable with cross-buy, even after multiplayer support ends.

Here is the full message from Beat Games:

Dear PlayStation 4 / PlayStation 5 players,

As we look to the future and plan the next big leap for Beat Saber, we have made the decision to no longer release updates for PlayStation 4 and PlayStation 5 starting in June 2025. Our passion for virtual reality remains unwavering. We are excited about the possibilities that lie ahead and what we can bring to Beat Saber fans who have been on this journey with us over the past seven years.

What this means for you:

  • This update will not impact your ability to keep playing Beat Saber, and you will still have access to content that you previously purchased on the PlayStation platform.
  • Beat Saber will still be available for purchase on PlayStation 4 and PlayStation 5 devices, and you can still play or purchase songs or music packs that were released prior to June 18, 2025. However, no new content will be released on these platforms after that date.
  • Additionally, starting on January 21, 2026, multiplayer will no longer be available in Beat Saber on PlayStation 4 and PlayStation 5.
  • Cross-buy, however, will remain active between the PlayStation 4 and PlayStation 5 base game.

We’re grateful for the incredible support you’ve shown us over the years, and we’re excited to share what the future holds for Beat Saber.

item.title: The House of the Dead 2: Remake launches August 7 for Switch and PC, later for PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, and Xbox One
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/the-house-of-the-dead-2-remake-launches-august-7-for-switch-and-pc-later-for-ps5-xbox-series-ps4-and-xbox-one

The House of the Dead 2: Remake will launch for Switch and PC via Steam and GOG on August 7 for $24.99 / €24.99, followed by PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, and Xbox One at a later date, publisher Forever Entertainment and developer MegaPixel Studio announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via Forever Entertainment:

About

The House of the Dead 2: Remake is a remake of the second entry in the well-known and popular rail shooter series. Take on the lone role of a secret agent as James or Gary, or team up in cooperative mode to neutralize the dangerous undead monsters standing in your way.

Story

In February 2000, a small city was suddenly overrun by hostile creatures. Two AMS agents, James Taylor and Gary Stewart, were sent to investigate. Upon arrival, they noticed that the situation resembled the Curien Mansion incident from 1998. Determined to uncover the source of the infestation, they began shooting their way through hordes of creatures.

Key Features

  • Remastered music (with the classic soundtrack also available in the game).
  • Modern graphics.
  • Gameplay faithful to the original game.
  • Cooperative mode.
  • Multiple endings and branching levels.

Various Game Modes

  • Classic Campaign – Almost two years after the events of the first installment, AMS agents James Taylor and Gary Stewart are deployed to investigate a city seized by undead creatures.
  • Boss Mode – Take on the challenge of defeating the game’s bosses as fast as you can.
  • Training Mode – Polish your skills in several available training scenarios to improve your abilities before deploying on a mission.
